speech:
potatoes take 70 to 120 days to develop and mature, depending on the type of potato and the climatic conditions of a particular area. Observe the vines for signs of senescence (drying out). Harden the skin of the crop by cutting the stems two weeks before harvesting to allow potatoes to develop a thick skin.
 Use a fork jembe or your hands (if the soil is loose) when harvesting to prevent excessive damage to tubers.
